text:
Affected versions of tomcat: tomcat 3.1.1, 3.2.2 b3,
3.3 m2, 3.2.1, 4.0
b3
It is not possible to use <jsp:include directive
within body of any
custom tag. It leads to Internal server errors (tomcat
3.x) or zero
result length (tomcat 4.x). One server crash was
detected on tomcat
3.1.1.
More precisely, calling of pageContext.include  inside
pageContext.pushBody and pageContext.popBody pair
leads to the same
proble.
To reporoduce:
 Go to any jsp page that contains custom tag with
body.  For example,
http://localhost:8080/examples/jsp/simpletag/foo.jsp
Put <jsp:include directive somewhere in the body of
custom tag.
<jsp:include page="/jsp/dates/date.jsp" flush="true"
/> in the example
above
Reload page. The server will get an internal server
error - can not
flush within custom tag

text:
jsp:include does not work on Tomcat 3.x.x because it requires that you set flush
to true but that causes the exception. The exception you get is correct as 
calling flush on BodyContent (which is what is happening) is documented as not
being supported. Where would you flush the content to ?

On Tomcat 4 you are allowed to set flush to false and that works inside a custom
tag.
